2025-08-05.content: [Generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages): You can consume reservations with Colab Enterprise runtimes. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your runtimes have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see [Use reservations with Colab Enterprise](https://cloud.google.com/colab/docs/reservations).

summary.title: Colab Enterprise now supports reservations
summary.summary: You can now use reservations with Colab Enterprise runtimes to ensure your runtimes have the resources they need.

2025-08-04.content: You can now use the new Data Science Agent to automate exploratory data analysis, perform machine learning tasks, and deliver insights from within a Colab Enterprise notebook. To get started, see [Use the Data Science Agent](https://cloud.google.com/colab/docs/use-data-science-agent). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Data Science Agent Available
summary.summary: Automate your data analysis and machine learning tasks with the new Data Science Agent in Colab Enterprise.

2025-06-30.content: [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages): You can consume reservations with Colab Enterprise runtimes. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your runtimes have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see [Use reservations with Colab Enterprise](https://cloud.google.com/colab/docs/reservations).

summary.title: Colab Enterprise now supports reservations
summary.summary: Colab Enterprise runtimes can now use reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources. This provides a higher level of assurance that your runtimes will have the necessary resources to run.

2025-05-28.content: Python 3.11 is now available in Colab Enterprise. Existing runtimes and runtime templates will remain using Python 3.10. For more information, see [Python versions](https://cloud.google.com/colab/docs/runtimes#python).

summary.title: Python 3.11 Now Available in Colab Enterprise
summary.summary: Python 3.11 is now available for use in Colab Enterprise. However, please note that existing runtimes and templates will continue to use Python 3.10.

2025-05-28.content:
When you create a runtime template, you can now configure it to use the latest Python version available to Colab Enterprise, or you can specify the Python version. Using `Latest` is a new option that means when a new version of Python is introduced to Colab Enterprise, runtimes that you create will use the latest Python version.

Existing runtime templates and runtimes remain using their current Python version (Python 3.10). This includes existing auto-generated default runtime templates. To create default runtime templates that use `Latest`, you must do one of the following:

* Delete the existing default runtime templates. Then, when a new default runtime template is created, the Python version will be set to Latest.
* [Change a runtime template's Python version](https://cloud.google.com/colab/docs/runtimes#change-python-version) by using the REST API.

summary.title: New Python version options for runtimes
summary.summary: You can now choose to use the latest available Python version for your Colab Enterprise runtimes or specify a particular version. Runtimes using the "Latest" option will automatically update to the newest Python version when it becomes available. Existing runtimes will continue to use their current Python version.
